channel.title: Chowdown
channel.description: The plain text recipe database for hackers

item.title: Broccoli Beer Cheese Soup
item.description: This recipe is inspired by Gourmand’s Beer Cheese Soup, which used Shiner Bock. Feel free to use whatever you want, then go to Gourmand’s to have the real thing.

item.title: Crockpot Buffalo Chicken
item.description: This is a party favorite, perfect for a Super Bowl or a game night. It takes a long time, but like most slow cooker recipes, is easy as hell. Bonus: guests love it.

item.title: Green Chile Stew
item.description: This is a simple one, consisting of a pre-made soup mix and whatever you’ve got around the kitchen (or campsite). Feel free to sub/swap/switch anything in the ingredient list— anything’s fair game!

item.title: One Minute Muffin
item.description: This flax muffin is quick, vertsatile (just mix in other goodies), and only makes one at a time, so you’ve got no huge tray to tempt you. Custom muffins every morning!

item.title: Pork Steaks
item.description: Pork is called “the other white meat”, but this sous vide technique is so dang good I’m gonna graduate it up to “THE white meat”.

item.title: Red Berry Tart
item.description: A favorite when I go to BBQs (parties, hackathons, your folks’ place), this red berry tart is fairly easy to make and packs a huge wow factor.

item.title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts
item.description:
A lot of places are doing dang good brussels lately, but none can touch Salty Sow. They serve them fried, topped with pecorino and golden raisins. Yes, please.

We started trying to emulate it, but it’s such a versatile dish, you can make it however you want. Consider this a loose guide.

item.title: Roasted Okra
item.description: I love me some okra, but prep is usually enough to avoid making it. This simple dish requires only a single cut per pod and a dash of seasoning- that’s it.

item.title: Smashed Carrots
item.description: Generally, canned carrots are stinky and not worth eating. Butter and cheese changes that.
